sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS To Be Held on March 9, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TO SHAREHOLDERS OF F5 NETWORKS, INC.:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual meeting of shareholders of F5 Networks, Inc. (the Company) for fiscal year 2016 will be held on March 9, 2017 at 11:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pacific Time at F5 Networks, Inc., 351 Elliott Avenue West, Seattle, Washington 98119 for the following purposes, as more fully described in the accompanying Proxy Statement:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. to elect nine (9) directors nominated by the Board of Directors of the Company to hold office until the annual meeting of shareholders for fiscal year 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. to approve the F5 Networks, Inc. 2014 Incentive Plan as amended and restated (the 2014 Plan) to increase the number of shares of common stock issuable under the 2014 Plan by an additional 1,100,000 shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. to ratify the selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. to conduct an advisory vote to approve the compensation of our named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. to conduct an advisory vote on the frequency of the advisory vote on compensation of our named executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only shareholders of record at the close of business on January 6, 2017 are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCOT F. ROGERS Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Seattle, Washington January 27, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE ANNUAL MEETING AND THESE PROXY MATERIALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why am I receiving these materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are receiving these materials because you are a shareholder of the Company as of the close of business on January 6, 2017 (the Record Date) and are entitled to receive notice of the Annual Meeting and to vote on matters that will be presented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement contains important information regarding our Annual Meeting, the proposals on which you are being asked to vote, information you may find useful in determining how to vote, and information about voting procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How does the Board of Directors recommend that I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the election of A. Gary Ames, Sandra E. Bergeron, Deborah L Bevier, Jonathan C. Chadwick, Michael L. Dreyer, Alan J. Higginson, Peter S. Klein, John McAdam and Stephen M. Smith as directors to hold office until the annual meeting of shareholders for fiscal year 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the proposal to approve the 2014 Plan to increase the number of shares of common stock issuable under the 2014 Plan by an additional 1,100,000 shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of our named executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the holding of future advisory votes on executive compensation annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Will there be any other items of business on the agenda?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is not aware, as of the date of this Proxy Statement, of any matters to be voted upon at the Annual Meeting other than those stated in this Proxy Statement and the accompanying Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other items of business or other matters are properly brought before the Annual Meeting, your proxy gives discretionary authority to the persons named on the proxy card with respect to those items of business or other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The persons named on the proxy card intend to vote the proxy in accordance with their best judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only holders of our common stock, no par value (the Common Stock), at the close of business on the Record Date may vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to the holders of Common Stock as shareholders throughout this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each shareholder is entitled to one vote for each share of Common Stock held as of the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What constitutes a quorum, and why is a quorum required?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We need a quorum of shares of Common Stock eligible to vote to conduct business at our Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum exists when at least a majority of the outstanding shares entitled to vote at the close of business on the Record Date are represented at the Annual Meeting either in person or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the close of business on the Record Date, we had 64,787,534 shares of Common Stock outstanding and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting, meaning that 32,393,768 shares of Common Stock must be represented in person or by proxy to have a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes (as described below) will also count towards the quorum requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your shares will be counted toward the number needed for a quorum if you:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) submit a valid proxy card or voting instruction form,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) give proper instructions over the telephone or on the Internet, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in the case of a shareholder of record, attend the Annual Meeting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the difference between holding shares as a shareholder of record and as a beneficial owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder of Record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are a shareholder of record if at the close of business on the Record Date your shares were registered directly in your name with American Stock Transfer, our transfer agent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are a beneficial owner if at the close of business on the Record Date your shares were held by a brokerage firm or other nominee and not in your name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Being a beneficial owner means that, like many of our shareholders, your shares are held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner, you have the right to direct your broker or nominee how to vote your shares by following the voting instructions your broker or other nominee provides.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to vote the shares you own beneficially at the meeting, you must first request and obtain a legal proxy from your broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not provide your broker or nominee with instructions on how to vote your shares or a legal proxy, your broker or nominee will be able to vote your shares with respect to some, but not all, of the proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see What will happen if I do not vote my shares?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and What if I do submit my proxy but do not specify how my shares are to be voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for additional information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of Record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record, there are several ways for you to vote your shares:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting by Mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may submit your vote by completing, signing and dating each proxy card received and returning it in the prepaid envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sign your name exactly as it appears on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy cards submitted by mail must be received no later than March 8, 2017 to be voted at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote by telephone or on the Internet, please do not return your proxy card unless you wish to change your vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting by Telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by telephone by using the toll-free number listed on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote on the Internet by using the voting portal found at www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with telephone voting, you can confirm that your instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting in person, we recommend that you also submit your proxy card or voting instructions or vote by telephone or via the Internet by the applicable deadline so that your vote will be counted if you later decide not to attend th meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by the method explained on the proxy card or the information you receive from the broker, nominee or other record holder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a beneficial shareholder would like to attend the shareholders meeting and cast a vote in person, hey may do so by requesting a legal proxy from their bank or broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions for obtaining the legal proxy are on the Vote nstruction Form or Notice of Internet Availability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I revoke or change my vote after I submit my proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke or change your vote after submitting your proxy by one of the following procedures:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivering a proxy revocation or another proxy bearing a later date to the Secretary of the Company at 401 Elliott Avenue West, Seattle, Washington 98119 before or at the Annual Meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have voted by internet or telephone and still have your control number, you may change your vote via internet or telephone up until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Time the day before the Annual Meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of Record by attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owners by obtaining a legal proxy from your broker or other nominee, attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that attendance alone at the Annual Meeting will not revoke a proxy; you must actually vote in person at the meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What will happen if I do not vote my shares?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of Record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the shareholder of record of your shares and you do not vote by mail, by telephone, via the Internet or in person at the Annual Meeting, your shares will not be voted at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of your shares, your broker or nominee may vote your shares only on those proposals on which it has discretion to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under applicable stock exchange rules, your broker or nominee does not have discretion to vote your shares on non-routine matters, which include Proposals 1, 2, 4 and 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, your broker or nominee does have discretion to vote your shares on routine matters such as Proposal 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What if I do submit my proxy but do not specify how my shares are to be voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record and you submit a proxy, but you do not provide voting instructions, your shares will be voted:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the election of A. Gary Ames, Sandra E. Bergeron, Deborah L Bevier, Jonathan C. Chadwick, Michael L. Dreyer, Alan J. Higginson, Peter S. Klein, John McAdam and Stephen M. Smith as directors to hold office until the annual meeting of shareholders for fiscal year 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the proposal to approve the 2014 Plan to increase the number of shares of common stock issuable under the 2014 Plan by an additional 1,100,000 shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of our named executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the holding of future advisory votes on executive compensation annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the effect of an abstention or a broker non-vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers or other nominees who hold shares of Common Stock for a beneficial owner have the discretion to vote on routine proposals when they have not received voting instructions from the beneficial owner at least ten days prior to the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when a broker or other nominee does not receive voting instructions from the beneficial owner and does not have the discretion to direct the voting of the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting on a proposal, or if a broker or nominee indicates it does not have discretionary authority to vote on a proposal, the shares will be counted for the purpose of determining if a quorum is present, but will not be included in the vote totals with respect to the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, any abstention or broker non-vote will have no effect on the proposals to be considered at the Annual Meeting since these actions do not represent votes cast by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the vote required for each proposal?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal    Vote Required*    Broker Discretionary Voting Allowed Proposal 1  Election of nine (9) directors to hold office until the annual meeting of shareholders for fiscal year 2017 and until his or her successor is elected and qualified    Majority of Votes Cast    No Proposal 2  To approve the 2014 Plan as amended and restated to increase the number of shares of Common Stock issuable under the 2014 Plan by an additional 1,100,000 shares    Majority of Votes Cast    No Proposal 3  Advisory vote to ratify the selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017    Majority of Votes Cast    Yes Proposal 4  Advisory vote to approve executive compensation    Majority of Votes Cast    No Proposal 5  Advisory vote on frequency of advisory vote on executive compensation    Plurality of Votes Cast    No
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Under Washington law and the Companys Third Amended and Restated Articles of Incorporation (the Articles) and Fifth Amended and Restated Bylaws (the Bylaws), if a quorum exists at the meeting, a nominee for director in an uncontested election will be elected by the vote of the majority of votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of votes cast means that the number of shares cast FOR a directors election exceeds the number of votes cast AGAINST that director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a director nominee who is an incumbent does not receive the requisite votes, that directors term will end on the earliest of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the date on which the Board appoints an individual to fill the office held by that director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 90 days after the date on which an inspector determines the voting results as to that director; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the date of the directors resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Proposals 2, 3 and 4, a majority of votes cast means that the number of votes cast FOR the matter exceeds the number of votes cast AGAINST the respective matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Proposal 1, you may vote FOR the nominee, AGAINST the nominee, or you may vote ABSTAIN as to the nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominee will be elected if he receives more FOR votes than AGAINST votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies may not be voted for more than nine (9) directors and shareholders may not cumulate votes in the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Proposals 2, 3 and 4, you may vote FOR, AGAINST or ABSTAIN as to each proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Proposal 5, you may vote for the frequency by choosing the option of one year, two years, three years or abstain from voting when you vote in response to the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What happens if the Annual Meeting is adjourned or postponed?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy will still be effective and will be voted at the rescheduled Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will still be able to change or revoke your proxy until it is voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is making this proxy solicitation and paying for the costs of this proxy solicitation?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of the Company is soliciting the proxies accompanying this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will pay all of the costs of this proxy solicitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, you will need to obtain your own Internet access if you choose to access the proxy materials and/or vote over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to mail solicitation, officers, directors, and employees of the Company may solicit proxies personally or by telephone, without receiving additional compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has retained Advantage Proxy to assist with the solicitation of proxies in connection with the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will pay Advantage Proxy customary fees, which are expected to be $5,750 plus expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company, if requested, will pay brokers, banks, and other fiduciaries that hold shares of Common Stock for beneficial owners for their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses of forwarding these materials to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I find the results of the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to announce preliminary voting results at the Annual Meeting and publish final results on a Form 8-K within four business days of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Form 8-K will be available on our website at www.f5.com under the About F5  Investor Relations  Corporate Governance  Governance Documents View All SEC Filings section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committees of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has standing Audit, Compensation, and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committees (collectively, the Standing Committees).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Standing Committees has a charter, copies of which are available on our website at www.f5.com under the About F5  Investor Relations  Corporate Governance section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described more fully in the Audit Committee charter, the functions of the Audit Committee include selecting, evaluating and, if necessary, replacing the Companys independent registered public accounting firm; reviewing and approving the planned scope, proposed fee arrangements and results of the annual audit; approving any proposed non-audit services to be provided by the independent registered public accounting firm; overseeing the adequacy of accounting and financial controls; reviewing the independence of the independent registered public accounting firm; and overseeing the Companys financial reporting process on behalf of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current Audit Committee members are Messrs. Chadwick (chairman), Dreyer and Klein and Ms. Bevier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bergeron also served on the Audit Committee in fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that Messrs. Chadwick and Klein are audit committee financial experts as defined in Item 407 of Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each current member of the Audit Committee is, and each member of the Audit Committee during fiscal year 2016 was, an independent director as defined by the Nasdaq Listing Rules (as independence is currently defined in Rule 5605(a)(2)).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee conducts an annual review to determine whether the Companys executive compensation program is meeting the goals and objectives set by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee recommends for approval by the Board of Directors the compensation for the Chief Executive Officer and directors, including salaries, incentive compensation levels and stock awards, and reviews and approves compensation proposals made by the Chief Executive Officer for the other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may form and delegate authority to subcommittees and may delegate authority to one or more designated members of the Compensation Committee or of the Board of Directors or to Company officers to perform certain of its duties on its behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee members are Ms. Bergeron (chair) and Ms. Bevier and Messrs. Ames, Dreyer, Higginson and Smith.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each current member of the Compensation Committee is, and each member of the Compensation Committee during fiscal year 2016 was, an independent director as defined by the Nasdaq Listing Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, the Compensation Committee retained an outside independent compensation consultant, Towers Watson, to advise the Compensation Committee on executive compensation issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Towers Watson provided the Compensation Committee peer and survey group cash and equity compensation data, including 50th and 75th percentile base salary, total cash, long-term incentive and total direct compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about the Compensation Committee and the information provided by Towers Watson to the Compensation Committee, see the description of the Compensation Committees activities in the Executive Compensation  Compensation Discussion and Analysis section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has determined that the work of Towers Watson has not raised any conflict of interest as defined in Item 407 of Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The functions of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee (the Nominating Committee) are to identify new potential Board members, recommend Board nominees, evaluate the Boards performance, and provide oversight of corporate governance and ethical conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee members are Messrs. Ames (chairman), Higginson and Smith, and Ms. Bergeron.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each current member of the Nominating Committee is, and each member of this committee during fiscal year 2016 was, an independent director as defined by the Nasdaq Listing Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company currently separates the roles of Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McAdam, the President and Chief Executive Officer, is responsible for setting the strategic direction of the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company and for the day-to-day leadership and performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Higginson, the Chairman of the Board, sets the agenda for and presides at Board meetings, and coordinates the Boards communications with Mr. McAdam and the Companys senior management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes this current structure balances the needs for the President and Chief Executive Officer to run the Company on a day-to-day basis with the benefit provided to the Company by Mr. Higginsons perspective as an independent member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assessing and managing risk is the responsibility of the Companys senior management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors oversees certain aspects of the Companys risk management efforts, and reviews and consults at each of the regular quarterly Board meetings with the Companys senior management team and the Companys Vice President of Internal Audit on strategic and operational opportunities, challenges and risks faced by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2010, the Company implemented an enterprise risk management program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company retained Ernst & Young to assist the Company in performing an enterprise risk assessment to identify key strategic, operating, legal and compliance, and financial risks, evaluate the significance of those risks, formulate a risk profile which identified relevant risk levels and management control efforts, and develop action plans to address these key risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys senior management team regularly reviews and evaluates these key risks and the effectiveness of the Companys risk management programs, and reported back to the Audit Committee and the full Board of Directors on a regular basis during fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee oversees the Companys financial risk exposures, financial reporting, and internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees the Companys executive compensation programs, monitors the administration of the Companys various equity compensation plans, and conducts compensation-related risk assessments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee oversees risk related to the Companys overall corporate governance profile and ratings; board and committee composition and structure; and director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Committee presents regular reports to the full Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards role in risk oversight has not had any effect on the Boards leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following directors served as members of the Compensation Committee during some or all of fiscal year 2016: Mses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bergeron (chair) and Bevier and Messrs. Ames, Dreyer, Higginson, and Smith.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of these persons has at any time been an officer or employee of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, none of the Companys executive officers served as a member of the board of directors or compensation committee of any entity that has had one or more executive officers that served as a member of the Companys Board of Directors or Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Person Transactions Policy and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As set forth in the written charter of the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors, any related person transaction involving a Company director or executive officer must be reviewed and approved by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any member of the Audit Committee who is a related person with respect to a transaction under review may not participate in the deliberations or vote on the approval or ratification of the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons include any director or executive officer, certain shareholders and any of their immediate family members (as defined by SEC regulations).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To identify any related person transaction, the Company requires each director and executive officer to complete a questionnaire each year requiring disclosure of any prior or proposed transaction with the Company in which the director, executive officer or any immediate family member might have an interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director and executive officer is directed to notify the Companys Executive Vice President and General Counsel of any such transaction that arises during the year, and the Companys Chief Financial Officer reports to the Audit Committee on a quarterly basis regarding any potential related person transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board of Directors determines on an annual basis which directors meet the definition of independent director under the Nasdaq Listing Rules and reviews any director relationship that would potentially interfere with his or her exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the Companys Policy and Procedures for Approving Related-Person Transactions is available on our website at www.f5.com under the About F5  Investor Relations  Corporate Governance section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain Relationships and Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Articles limit the liability of the Companys directors for monetary damages arising from their conduct as directors, except to the extent otherwise required by the Articles of Incorporation and the Washington Business Corporation Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Articles also provide that the Company may indemnify its directors and officers to the fullest extent permitted by Washington law, including in circumstances in which indemnification is otherwise discretionary under Washington law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has entered into indemnification agreements with the Companys directors and certain officers for the indemnification of, and advancement of expenses to, these persons to the fullest extent permitted by law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also intends to enter into these agreements with the Companys future directors and certain future officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings of the Board of Directors and Standing Committees; Attendance at Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Board of Directors met or acted by unanimous written consent 15 times during fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee met 10 times and the Compensation Committee met or acted by unanimous written consent 15 times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee met 8 times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The outside directors met 7 times during fiscal 2016, with no members of management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Board of Directors attended 75% or more of the Board of Directors meetings during fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Board of Directors who served on one or more of the Standing Committees attended at least 75% of the total number of meetings of the Standing Committees on which the director served during fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors are also expected to be present at the Companys annual meetings of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors attended the Companys annual meeting of shareholders for fiscal year 2015 except Mrs. Bevier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of the Company currently consists of nine (9) directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has nominated the following nine (9) directors for election to the Board of Directors at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name    Director Since   A. Gary Ames     7/2004   Sandra E. Bergeron     1/2013   Deborah L. Bevier     7/2006   Jonathan C. Chadwick     8/2011   Michael L. Dreyer     10/2012   Alan J. Higginson     5/1996   Peter S. Klein     3/2015   John McAdam     7/2000   Stephen M. Smith     1/2013
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors or their respective successors will stand for election on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominees have consented to serve as directors of the Company if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a nominee declines to serve or becomes unavailable for any reason, or if a vacancy occurs before the election (although we know of no reason to anticipate that this will occur), the proxies may be voted for a substitute nominee as the Company may designate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nasdaq Listing Rules require that a majority of the Companys directors be independent, as defined by Nasdaq Listing Rule 5605(a)(2) and determined by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors consults with the Companys legal counsel to ensure that the Board of Directors determinations are consistent with all relevant securities and other laws and regulations regarding the definition of independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After a review of any relevant transactions or relationships between each director, or any of his or her family members, and the Company, its senior management and its independent registered public accounting firm, the Board of Directors has determined that the following directors and nominees are independent: A. Gary Ames, Sandra E. Bergeron, Deborah L. Bevier, Jonathan C. Chadwick, Michael L. Dreyer, Alan J. Higginson, Peter S. Klein and Stephen M. Smith.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John McAdam is not considered independent because he is the Companys President and Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2010, the Board of Directors adopted stock ownership guidelines for the Companys directors and executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are required to own shares of Common Stock equal in value to five times the directors annual cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are required to achieve this ownership level within three years of joining the Board or, in the case of directors serving at the time the guidelines were adopted, within three years of the date of adoption of these guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares of Common Stock that count toward satisfaction of the guidelines include shares purchased on the open market, shares obtained through stock option exercises, shares obtained through grants of Restricted Stock Units, and shares beneficially owned in a trust, by a spouse and/or minor children.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares owned by directors are valued at the greater of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the price at the time of acquisition/purchase or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the current market value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following individuals have been nominated for election to the Board of Directors or will continue to serve on the Board of Directors after the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John McAdam, age 65, has served as our President, Chief Executive Officer and a director since July 2000 (with the exception of the period of July 1, 2015 to December 13, 2015 when he served as our non-executive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ) Prior to joining us, Mr. McAdam served as General Manager of the Web server sales business at International Business Machines Corporation from September 1999 to July 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From January 1995 until August 1999, Mr. McAdam served as the President and Chief Operating Officer of Sequent Computer Systems, Inc., a manufacturer of high-end open systems, which was sold to International Business Machines Corporation in September 1999.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McAdam serves as a director of Tableau Software, a publicly- held company that provides business intelligence software, Apptio, a publicly-held company that provides technology business management and Nutanix, a publicly-held provider of converged infrastructure solutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McAdam holds a B.S. in Computer Science from the University of Glasgow, Scotland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McAdam has led the Company for over 15 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since his appointment as President and Chief Executive Officer, the Companys annual revenues have grown from $108.6 million in fiscal year 2000 to $2 billion in fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has been the driving force behind the strategies and execution which have resulted in the Companys history of strong operating results and significant growth in shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McAdam brings to the Board of Directors a comprehensive knowledge of and valuable insight into the Companys technology, strategy, competitive opportunities, operations, financial position, and relationships within the industry analyst and investment communities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is the sole member of management on the Board of Directors and serves a critical role in the communication between the Board of Directors and the Companys senior management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alan J. Higginson, age 69, has served as Board of Directors chair since April 2004 (with the exception of the period of July 1, 2015 to December 13, 2015 when he served as our Lead Independent Director), and as one of our directors since May 1996.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Higginson served as Chairman of Hubspan, Inc., an e-business infrastructure provider, from September 2009 to March 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Hubspan from August 2001 to September 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From November 1995 to November 1998, Mr. Higginson served as President of Atrieva Corporation, a provider of advanced data backup and retrieval technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Higginson also serves as a director of Pivot3, Inc., a privately-held company that develops and markets shared storage and virtual server appliances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Higginson also served as a director of adeptCloud Inc., a privately-held company that provides cloud-based collaboration services and Clarity Health Services, a privately-held company that provides web-based health care coordination services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Higginson holds a B.S. in Commerce and an M.B.A. from Santa Clara University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Higginson has over 30 years of experience as a senior executive in a wide range of both public and private software and other technology companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His experience includes leading worldwide sales organizations and the management of international joint ventures and distribution channels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has also been active in a number of software and technology industry associations, and as an advisor to early-stage technology companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Higginson joined our Board of Directors shortly after the Company was founded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His deep understanding of the Companys historical and current business strategies, objectives and technologies provides an important and insightful perspective for our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A. Gary Ames, age 72, has served as one of our directors since July 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ames served as President and Chief Executive Officer of MediaOne International, a provider of broadband and wireless communications from July 1995 until his retirement in June of 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From January 1990 to July 1995, he served as President and Chief Executive Officer of US West Communications, a regional provider of residential and business telephone services, and operator and carrier services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ames also serves as a director of MMGL Corporation (formally known as Schnitzer Investment Corp.), a privately-held investment firm with interests in commercial, industrial and multi-family properties, real estate development projects, ocean shipping, and other industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ames served as a director of Tektronix, Inc., a publicly-traded supplier of test, measurement, and monitoring products, from 1993 to 2008; SuperValu, Inc., a publicly-traded food and drug retailer, from 2006 to 2010 and iPass, Inc., a publicly-traded enterprise mobility company, from 2002 to 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ames holds a B.A. in Finance from Portland State University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ames has extensive experience as a senior executive and chief executive officer in the telecommunications industry in the United States, South America, Europe and Asia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He provides to the Board of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors valuable insight into large telecommunications enterprises, which are an important customer base for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For over twenty years, Mr. Ames has served on a number of other boards, as chairman of compensation and governance committees, and as a member of public company audit committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ames brings to the Board of Directors expertise and insight as a former chief executive officer, broad experience as director at a wide range of companies and international business experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His experience as a chief executive officer and member of public company audit committees qualifies him as an audit committee financial expert as defined in Item 407 of Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deborah L. Bevier, age 65, has served as one of our directors since July 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bevier has been the principal of D.L. Bevier Consulting LLC, an organizational and management consulting firm, since 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that time, from 1996 until 2003, Ms. Bevier served as a director, President and Chief Executive Officer of Laird Norton Financial Group and its predecessor companies, an independent financial advisory services firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1973 to 1996, Ms. Bevier held numerous leadership positions with KeyCorp, including chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Key Bank of Washington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bevier served on the board of directors of Outerwall, Inc. (formerly Coinstar, Inc.), a publicly-traded multi-national provider of services to retailers from 2002 to 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She served on the board of directors of Fisher Communications, Inc., a publicly-traded media and communications company, from 2003 to 2010, and Puget Sound Bank, a commercial bank, from 2006 to 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bevier holds a B.S. in Economics from SUNY New Paltz and a graduate degree from Stonier Graduate School of Banking at Rutgers University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bevier has over 37 years of experience with both public and private companies in a wide range of areas including finance, banking, management, and organizational operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Beviers experience as a director of public companies in the consumer services, communications, and media industries enables her to bring a valuable perspective to our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to Ms. Beviers broad background, her extensive strategic, corporate governance, and compensation expertise makes her well qualified to serve on our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jonathan C. Chadwick, age 50, has served as one of our directors since August 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chadwick is currently on the boards of Cognizant Corporation and ServiceNow, and he is an advisor to a number of private and public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Between November 2012 and April 2016, Mr. Chadwick was Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer/Chief Operating Officer at VMware.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining VMware, Mr. Chadwick served as the Chief Financial Officer of Skype and as a corporate vice president of Microsoft Corporation after its acquisition of Skype in October 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chadwick joined Skype from McAfee where he was Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer from June 2010 until February 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1997 to 2010, he held various finance roles at Cisco Systems, including Senior Vice President, Chief Financial Officer  Global Customer Markets, Senior Vice President, Corporate Controller and Principal Accounting Officer, and Vice President, Corporate Finance & Planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also worked for Coopers & Lybrand in various roles in the US and UK.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chadwick is a Chartered Accountant in England and holds an honors degree in electrical and electronic engineering from the University of Bath, UK.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chadwick has extensive experience as a finance executive in the computer networking and security software industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, his background in high growth enterprises and significant corporate transactions brings an important and valuable perspective to our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a chief financial officer of a major multi-national enterprise, his expertise in accounting and financial controls qualifies him as an audit committee financial expert as defined in Item 407 of Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael L. Dreyer, age 53, has served as one of our directors since October 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dreyer is currently the Chief Operating Officer for Silicon Valley Bank, a high-tech commercial bank, and prior to that Mr. Dreyer served as Chief Operation Officer at Monitise, a technology leader in mobile banking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Monitise, he was the Chief Information Officer at Visa Inc. from July, 2005 to March, 2014 where he was responsible for the companys systems and technology platforms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before joining Visa Inc., he was Chief Information Officer of Inovant, where he oversaw the development and management of Visas global systems technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nomination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Criteria for Nomination to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee considers the appropriate balance of experience, skills and characteristics required of the Board of Directors, and seeks to ensure that at least a majority of the directors are independent under the Nasdaq Listing Rules, that members of the Companys Audit Committee meet the financial literacy requirements under the Nasdaq Listing Rules and that at least one of them qualifies as an audit committee financial expert under the rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominees for director are selected on the basis of their depth and breadth of experience, integrity, ability to work effectively as part of a team, understanding of the Companys business environment, and willingness to devote adequate time to Board duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating director candidates, regardless of the source of the nomination, the Nominating Committee will consider, in accordance with its Charter, the composition of the Board as a whole, the requisite characteristics (including independence, diversity, skills and experience) of each candidate, and the performance and continued tenure of incumbent Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to diversity, we broadly construe diversity to mean not only diversity of race, gender and ethnicity, but also diversity of opinions, perspectives, and professional and personal experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominees are not discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or any other basis proscribed by law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the backgrounds and qualifications of the directors, considered as a group, should provide a significant composite mix of experience, knowledge and abilities that will allow the Board to fulfill its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board therefore considers diversity in identifying nominees for director, but does not have a separate policy directed toward diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposals for Nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee will consider written proposals from shareholders for nominees for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such nominations should be submitted to the Nominating Committee c/o the Corporate Secretary and should include the following information:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) all information relating to such nominee that is required to be disclosed pursuant to Regulation 14A under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act) (including such persons written consent to being named in the proxy statement as a nominee and to serving as a director if elected);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the name(s) and address(es) of the shareholders(s) making the nomination and the number of shares of Common Stock that are owned beneficially and of record by such shareholders(s);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) appropriate biographical information and a statement as to the qualification of the nominee and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) any information required by the Bylaws of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such nominations should be submitted in the time frame described in the Bylaws of the Company and under the caption Shareholder Proposals for the Annual Meeting for Fiscal Year 2017 below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Process for Identifying and Evaluating Nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process for identifying and evaluating nominees to fill vacancies on the Board of Directors is initiated by conducting an assessment of critical Company and Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: needs, based on the present and future strategic objectives of the Company and the specific skills required for the Board as a whole and for each Board Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A third-party search firm may be used by the Nominating Committee to identify qualified candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These candidates are evaluated by the Nominating Committee by reviewing the candidates biographical information and qualifications and checking the candidates references.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Serious candidates meet with all members of the Board and as many of the Companys executive officers as practical.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using the input from such interviews and the information obtained by the Nominating Committee, the full Board determines whether to appoint a candidate to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee will evaluate the skills and experience of existing Board members against the Companys critical needs in making recommendations for nomination by the full Board of candidates for election by the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominees to the Board of Directors described in this Proxy Statement were approved unanimously by the Companys directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Klein was recommended by a third-party search firm retained by the Nominating Committee at the Companys expense in fiscal year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The third-party search firm was provided guidance as to the particular skills, experience and other characteristics the Nominating Committee was seeking in potential candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The third-party search firm identified a number of potential candidates, including Mr. Klein, and prepared background materials on these candidates, which were provided to the members of the Nominating Committee for their review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The third-party search firm interviewed those candidates the Nominating Committee determined merited further consideration, and assisted in arranging interviews of selected candidates with members of the Nominating Committee, other members of the Board of Directors, and certain of the Companys executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The third-party search firm also completed reference checks on the candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee expects that a similar process will be used to evaluate nominees recommended by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, to date, the Company has not received any shareholders proposal to nominate a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who wish to communicate with our directors may do so by contacting them c/o Corporate Secretary, F5 Networks, Inc., 401 Elliott Avenue West, Seattle, Washington 98119.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Risk Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and Company management have reviewed the Companys compensation plans and programs and have concluded that none of these plans or programs is reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this evaluation, the Compensation Committee reviewed the key elements of each of the Companys compensation programs and the means by which any potential risks are mitigated, including through various elements in the Companys enterprise risk management program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: addition, in fiscal year 2016, the Company engaged Radford to conduct a thorough review of its employee compensation programs to evaluate compensation components, design and to benchmark against the industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation programs include a mix of base salary, cash incentive compensation, and long-term equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incentive compensation and performance- based annual equity awards programs for the executive officers include both revenue and EBITDA targets intended to ensure that the executive officers appropriately manage operating risks, avoid excessive risk-taking, and maintain the Companys gross margin and operating margin targets while growing its revenue base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review and discussions, the Compensation Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in this Proxy Statement and the Companys Annual Report to Shareholders on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended September 30, 2016.

sentences.text: Introduction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis provides information about the fiscal year 2016 compensation program for our fiscal year 2016 named executive officers (sometimes referred to herein as NEOs) who are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John McAdam, President and Chief Executive Officer (Mr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: McAdam served as our President and CEO (and principal executive officer) from October 1, 2014 to July 1, 2015, when he retired as President and CEO and assumed the role of Chairman of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following Mr. Rivelos resignation in December of 2015, Mr. McAdam again began serving as President and CEO and a director but resigned as Chairman of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Manuel Rivelo, Former President and Chief Executive Officer (Mr. Rivelo was appointed President and Chief Executive Officer on July 1, 2015 and resigned from the position on December 13, 2015)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John DiLullo, Executive Vice President of Worldwide Sales
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Edward J. Eames, Executive Vice President of Business Operations (Mr. Eames was promoted to the title of Executive Vice President and Chief Operations Officer on October 23, 2015.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benjamin Gibson, Executive Vice President of Marketing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Karl Triebes, Former Executive Vice President of Product Development and Chief Technical Officer (Mr. Triebes resigned from his position of Executive Vice President and Chief Technical Officer on August 30, 2016.)

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer Transition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McAdams CEO Compensation for Fiscal Year 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with Mr. McAdams re-appointment to the role of President and CEO on December 13, 2015, the Compensation Committee initiated an evaluation of an appropriate compensation arrangement for Mr. McAdam as CEO for recommendation to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining its recommendation, the Committee considered factors including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market data compiled by its independent consultant, Towers Watson, on compensation paid to other CEOs on both an interim and permanent basis;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McAdams prior compensation with the Company as President and CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of long term incentive awards forfeited by Mr. McAdam upon his retirement in fiscal year 201
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value and stability Mr. McAdam brings to the role given his understanding of the Company and its business from his long-tenured role as President and CEO; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The modest percentage increases in base salary for the other named executive officers in fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After evaluating these factors, the Committee recommended a compensation package for Mr. McAdam to the full Board for approval, which consists of the following components for fiscal year 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual base salary rate of $910,000, which represents an approximate increase of 4% over his fiscal year 2015 annual base salary rate;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A performance bonus consisting of 130% of his base salary, which is the same as his fiscal year 2015 bonus percentage; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An award of RSUs with such award to be for the number of shares of Company Common Stock determined by dividing $3,750,000 by the fair market value of a share of the Common Stock on the close of trading on February 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant is to vest quarterly over a one-year period from February 1, 2016 without a continuous service requirement, with 60% of such award (plus additional RSUs subject to an over-achievement allocation, if any) constituting performance-based awards subject to performance-based vesting formula as established by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the recommendations of the Compensation Committee and its independent consultant, the Board approved the fiscal year 2016 compensation arrangement for Mr. McAdam.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Rivelos Compensation as CEO for Fiscal Year 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating Mr. Rivelos compensation for Fiscal Year 2016, the Committee conducted an evaluation of an appropriate compensation arrangement for Mr. Rivelo as CEO for recommendation to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered the ollowing factors including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market data compiled by its independent consultant, Towers Watson, on compensation paid to other CEOs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McAdams prior compensation with the Company as President and CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Rivelos recent appointment to the role of CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After evaluating these factors, the Committee recommended a compensation package for Mr. Rivelo to the full Board for approval, which consists of the following components for fiscal year 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Compensation  The first component was an increase in Mr. Rivelos base salary from $650,000 to $725,000, an 11.5% increase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given that Mr. Rivelo was a recently appointed first-time chief executive, the Committee and the independent members of the Board agreed that it was appropriate to set his target base salary, bonus and total direct compensation below the 50th percentile for the peer group and at a lower level than Mr. McAdams compensation as a long tenured, successful CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, consistent with the Companys philosophy that the principal executive officers compensation be more heavily weighted towards performance-based compensation, the Board maintained his target bonus at 130% of his annual base salary at target, for a total annual cash compensation target of $1,667,500, which also falls below the 50th percentile for the Companys proxy peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation  The second component of Mr. Rivelos compensation as a principal executive officer was a grant of restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Again, consistent with the Companys compensation policy, the Compensation Committee recommended and the independent members of the Board approved a long term incentive award consisting of the right to receive restricted stock units having an aggregate target fair market value of approximately $6,000,000 on the date of the grant, of which half of the target value of the restricted stock units were time-based restricted unit awards and half of the target value of the awards were performance-based restricted stock units (which performance-based restricted stock units will be subject to an overachievement allocation, if applicable).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These restricted stock unit awards would have vested to the extent applicable quarterly through fiscal 2019 and otherwise be subject to such other terms as set forth in the F5 Network, Inc. 2014 Incentive Plan and applicable award agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Rivelos Separation Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with Mr. Rivelos resignation from the Company as President and CEO and as a member of the Board after serving through approximately 5/6 of the first quarter of fiscal year 2016, the Company entered into a Waiver and Non-Competition Agreement and General Release of All Claims with Mr. Rivelo.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consideration for the covenants contained in such agreement, including the general release and a one-year non-competition clause, th Company agreed to provide Mr. Rivelo the following compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5/6 of his performance bonus (MBO) for the first quarter of fiscal year 2016; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5/6 of the time-based and performance-based RSU awards for the first quarter of fiscal year 2016 and scheduled to vest on February 1, 2016 (consisting of 7,734 shares at target).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Rivelo forfeited his remaining unvested RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Changes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to Mr. Rivelos resignation and Mr. McAdams reappointment to the role of President and CEO, we made other significant leadership changes in fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Chief Marketing Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Benjamin Gibson joined the Company as Executive Vice President of Marketing on August 1, 2016 following an extensive executive search.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining F5, he was Chief Marketing Officer at Veritas, where he led the companys rebranding efforts, following a spin-off from Symantec.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to Veritas, Gibson served as Chief Marketing Officer at Aruba Networks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before joining Aruba, Gibson spent five years at Cisco Systems, most recently as Vice President of Data Center/Virtualization Marketing, where he ran the outbound marketing strategy and execution for a number of Ciscos application networking products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gibson has also held leadership roles in product marketing at Meru Networks and Proxim Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Triebes Separation Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On September 6, 2016 the Company announced that Mr. Triebes had notified the Company on August 30, 2016 of his resignation as the Companys Executive Vice President of Product Development and Chief Technical Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with Mr. Triebes transition from the Company, on September 26, 2016, the Company and Mr. Triebes entered into a Separation and Consulting Agreement and General Release of All Claims (the Agreement), whereby Mr. Triebes would continue his employment to provide consulting services to the Company through a separation date of January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the Agreement, Mr. Triebes agreed to, among other things, non-competition and non-solicitation obligations and a waiver and release of claims.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with provision of his continued services to the Company, Mr. Triebes received his base salary through his separation date of January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, following his separation date and subject to his execution of a further waiver and release of claims through such date, Mr. Triebes will receive a lump sum payment of $1,084,400 less applicable deductions and taxes, which amount will include his target cash bonus for the first quarter of fiscal year 2017 and a payment which may be used to pay for COBRA coverage or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, pursuant to his continuing relationship with the Company, Mr. Triebes continued to vest 3,327 time-based restricted stock units and 3,189 performance-based restricted stock units for the fourth quarter of fiscal 2016 which vested on November 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Triebes forfeited the remainder of his unvested restricted stock units.

sentences.text: Compensation Policies and Practices Linked to Shareholder Value Creation and Mitigation of Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of compensation for the President and CEO is performance-based compensation which is at risk if certain threshold achievement is not met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No excise tax gross ups  the Company does not provide for golden parachute excise tax gross-ups upon a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company offers only modest perquisites to its executive officers that are supported by a business interest and which ar consistent with broad-based benefit plans that are available to other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent compensation consultant  the Committee retains an independent compensation consulting firm which provides no other services to the Company other than services for the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines  the Board and Company executives are subject to stock ownership requirements that encourage alignment with the interests of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback policy  incentive compensation for certain executives may be subject to recoupment in the event the Company restates its reported financial results to correct a material accounting error on an interim or annual financial statement included in a report on Form 10-Q or 10-K due to material noncompliance with a financial reporting requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No hedging or pledging of stock  executive officers are prohibited from entering into hedging or pledging transactions or trading in puts, calls or other derivatives of the Companys Common Stock or otherwise engaging in short sales of Common Stock of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No re-pricing of options  under the terms of the F5 Networks, Inc. 2014 Incentive Plan, the re-pricing of underwater options is prohibited absent shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double trigger change of control agreements  the Companys change of control agreements with its executives contain a double trigger feature.

sentences.text: Results of 2016 Shareholder Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating the Companys executive compensation program for fiscal year 2016, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors (the Committee) considered the shareholder annual advisory vote on executive compensation for fiscal year 2015 which was approved by over 87% of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes this vote reflects a high level of approval of the executive ompensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee carefully considers feedback from shareholders regarding the Companys executive ompensation, including the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: results of the shareholders annual advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also meets regularly with shareholders and analysts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are invited to express their views to the Committee, including as described above under the heading Communications with Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Program Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objectives of our executive compensation program are to correlate executive compensation with the Companys business objectives, performance and the creation of shareholder value, and to enable the Company to attract, retain and reward key executive officers who contribute to its long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the total direct compensation our named executive officers received in fiscal year 2016 as set forth in the Summary Compensation Table on page 37 is consistent with and reflects these objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal Year 2016 Corporate Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys total annual revenue in fiscal year 2016, $2 billion, was the highest ever and an increase of 4% over fiscal year 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash flow from operating activities was $712 million and GAAP net income was $366 million, both the highest in the Companys history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintained very strong GAAP gross margins and operating margins throughout fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GAAP gross margin and GAAP operating margin were 83.1% and 27.4% respectively for fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GAAP operating margin improved in the second half of fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company continued to maintain a very strong balance sheet, ending the fiscal year with cash and investments totaling approximately $1.2 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
